data.title: planner
data.markdown:
Great, I will plan a 5-day trip for 2 people to Paris from Jakarta, departing on December 20, 2025, with a total budget of 3000 USD. Here is the itinerary I've put together based on your details:

Here is the planning trip I would like to recommend:
1. 20 December 2025 to 25 December 2025
 Total Round-Trip Flights from Jakarta (CGK) to Paris (CDG) for 2 people.
 Budget: 1200 USD
2. 20 December 2025 to 24 December 2025
 4 Nights Accommodation in a budget-friendly hotel in Paris.
 Budget: 400 USD
3. Visas
 Schengen Visa fees for 2 people. The fee is €80 per person, which is approximately $90.
 Budget: 180 USD
4. Day 1: 20 December 2025 - Arrival and Local Exploration
 Arrive at Charles de Gaulle Airport (CDG), take public transport to your hotel. After settling in, take a walk to explore the neighborhood and enjoy the Christmas lights. For dinner, find a local bistro for a classic French meal.
 Budget: 190 USD (Includes 5-day transportation pass and food).
5. Day 2: 21 December 2025 - Art and Icons
 Visit the Louvre Museum in the morning (book tickets online in advance to save time). A standard ticket costs around €22. In the afternoon, visit the iconic Eiffel Tower. A ticket to the summit via the elevator is approximately €35.30 per person. Considering the cold weather, you'll appreciate the indoor views.
 Budget: 230 USD (Includes museum/attraction tickets and food).
6. Day 3: 22 December 2025 - Impressionist Art & River Views
 Spend the morning at the Musée d'Orsay, famous for its Impressionist collection, with standard tickets costing around €16-€17.50. In the afternoon, take a relaxing Seine River cruise to see the city's landmarks from a different perspective. Enjoy dinner at a Christmas market.
 Budget: 230 USD (Includes museum tickets and food).
7. Day 4: 23 December 2025 - Montmartre and Sacré-Cœur
 Explore the charming hilltop district of Montmartre. Visit the beautiful Sacré-Cœur Basilica (entry is free), and wander through the artists' square, Place du Tertre. Enjoy a final Parisian dinner in this atmospheric area.
 Budget: 230 USD (Includes food and local transport).
8. Day 5: 24 December 2025 - Last-Minute Souvenirs and Departure
 Enjoy a final Parisian breakfast with a croissant and coffee. Do some last-minute souvenir shopping before heading back to the airport for your departure. A budget of around €45 per person per day is average for meals.
 Budget: 180 USD (Includes food).

Your Trip will take around 2840 USD
and you have a budget left around 160 USD

data.title: document
data.markdown:
Indonesian citizens traveling to France are required to obtain a Schengen visa for short stays, typically up to 90 days within a 180-day period, for purposes such as tourism, business, or visiting family. A tourist visa does not permit working or studying in France.

Here are the general travel document requirements for Indonesian citizens applying for a Schengen visa to France:

* Schengen Visa Application Form A completed and signed visa application form is required.
* Passport Your passport must be valid for at least three months beyond your planned departure from the Schengen Area, have been issued within the last 10 years, and contain at least two blank pages. Any previous passports should also be provided.
* Photographs You will need recent passport-sized photographs (e.g., 3.5 cm x 4.5 cm) that meet specific requirements, such as having a white or light-colored background and being taken within the last six months.
* Cover Letter A cover letter outlining your personal information, the purpose of your visit, your financial means, and your intention to return to Indonesia is necessary.
* Proof of Financial Means You must demonstrate sufficient funds to cover your stay. This can include recent bank statements, payslips, business registration documents (if self-employed), pension statements (if retired), or property deeds.
* Travel Insurance Mandatory travel insurance is required, valid for all Schengen countries, with a minimum coverage of €30,000. This insurance must cover emergency medical expenses, hospitalization, repatriation, and explicitly cover potential COVID-19 treatment.
* Roundtrip Tickets/Flight Itinerary Proof of your confirmed roundtrip flight reservations to and from the Schengen Area is needed, along with any intra-Schengen travel plans if you intend to visit multiple countries.
* Proof of Accommodation You must provide evidence of accommodation for your entire stay, such as hotel reservations or a letter of invitation if you will be staying with a host.
* Civil Status Certificate Documents like a marriage certificate may be requested.
* Employment Documents If employed, a letter from your employer with a

confirming your leave and employment details is required. For self-employed individuals, business registration documents and company bank statements are needed. Students require proof of enrollment and a no-objection letter from their educational institution.

Application Process:
Indonesian citizens must apply for a Schengen visa at the French embassy in Jakarta or a designated visa application center, such as TLScontact. An appointment is required for an interview and document submission. It is recommended to apply at least three weeks before your planned trip, though applications can be submitted up to six months in advance. Processing times can vary, potentially reaching up to three weeks during peak seasons. The standard visa application fee is €80, with a reduced fee of €40 for children between 6 and 11 years old. Children under six are exempt from the fee.

data.title: hotel
data.markdown:
For your trip to Paris on December 20, 2025, a wide variety of hotel options are available across numerous booking platforms. You can find and compare hotels through sites like KAYAK, Expedia, Hotels.com, Wego, Orbitz, Trivago, and Skyscanner, which offer filters for price, star rating, amenities, and location.

Some popular districts in Paris for accommodations include the 8th Arrondissement (Champs Elysees), 6th Arrondissement (Saint Germain - Luxembourg), 7th Arrondissement (Eiffel Tower - Invalides), and areas near popular attractions like the Louvre Museum or Gare du Nord.

Examples of hotels mentioned in search results include:
* Highly-rated options: Hotel Plaza Athenee, Hôtel Madame Rêve, and Goralska Résidences Hôtel Paris Bastille.
* Hotels near specific landmarks: Pullman Paris Tour Eiffel and Mercure Paris Centre Tour Eiffel are close to the Eiffel Tower.
* Options across different price points: From luxury stays like Le Royal Monceau - Raffles Paris and Bulgari Hotel Paris to more budget-friendly choices like ibis budget hotels and hostels, there's a range to suit various budgets.

When searching, consider factors such as your budget, desired amenities (e.g., free cancellation, free breakfast, pool, pet-friendly options), and the specific neighborhood you'd like to stay in based on your planned activities. Many sites also offer traveler reviews to help you make an informed decision.

data.title: transport
data.markdown:
For your trip from Jakarta, Indonesia to Paris, France, departing on December 20, 2025, and returning on December 25, 2025 (a 5-day trip), here's what you need to know about transportation:

* No Direct Flights: There are no direct or non-stop flights available from Jakarta (Soekarno Hatta International Airport - CGK) to Paris (Charles de Gaulle Airport - CDG). All flights will include at least one stopover.
* Airlines: Numerous airlines operate this route with layovers. Popular choices include Qatar Airways, Emirates, Turkish Airlines, Air France, Malaysia Airlines, Cathay Pacific, Singapore Airlines, KLM, Etihad Airways, Saudia, and Thai Airways International.
* Flight Duration: The shortest flights with one stop typically range from approximately 16 hours and 10 minutes to 17 hours and 10 minutes. However, the total travel time can be significantly longer (up to 35 hours or more) depending on the number and duration of layovers.
* Common Layover Locations: Potential layover cities include Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Doha, Dubai, Istanbul, Abu Dhabi, Amsterdam, Hong Kong, and Seoul.
* Estimated Costs: Prices can vary significantly. Recent searches indicate round-trip flights starting from around $550 to $680 USD, although some one-way flights have been found for as low as $276-$305 USD. Typical prices can range between €650 and €1,750 (approximately $700-$1,900 USD) depending on the airline and booking class.
* Booking Advice: To secure better prices, it's generally recommended to book international flights at least two months in advance. Some sources suggest booking around 40 days (6 weeks) prior to departure. Flexibility with your travel dates can also help in finding cheaper fares.

Given that December 2025 is a popular travel period, it's advisable to check flight comparison websites and airline direct sites as soon as possible for the most accurate and up-to-date pricing and availability for your specific dates.
